glsa.title: GD: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: The GD library is prone to a buffer overflow vulnerability.

background.p: GD is a graphic library for fast image creation.

description.p: Tomas Hoger reported that the _gdGetColors() function in gd_gd.c does not properly verify the colorsTotal struct member, possibly leading to a buffer overflow.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image file with a program using the GD library, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All GD users should upgrade to the latest version:
NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are available since November 21, 2009. It is likely that your system is already no longer affected by this issue.
